title: Post With Code written in Jupyter Notebook: Executed on GHA
text:
This article is written and edited as a Jupyter notebook with a stale code cell. The original frozen cell output shows a linear graph, but the current code produces an exponential curve.

import plotly.express as px
import polars as pl
import io
import PIL.Image

data = pl.DataFrame(
    {
        "x": [1, 2, 3],
        "y": [2**1, 2**2, 2**3],
    }
)
fig = px.scatter(data_frame=data, x="x", y="y")

# --- render as png ---
buf = io.BytesIO()
fig.write_image(buf, engine="kaleido", scale=10)
img = PIL.Image.open(buf)
img

title: Post With Code written in Jupyter Notebook
text:
This is an article written in a jupyter notebook and published by Qaurto.

import plotly.express as px
import polars as pl
import io
import PIL.Image

data = pl.DataFrame(
    {
        "x": [1, 2, 3],
        "y": [2, 4, 6],
    }
)
fig = px.scatter(data_frame=data, x="x", y="y")

# --- render as png ---
buf = io.BytesIO()
fig.write_image(buf, engine="kaleido", scale=10)
img = PIL.Image.open(buf)
img

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.
